alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 06 at 4:22AM PST until December 07 at 4:04PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Snohomish River At Snohomish affecting Snohomish County. Snohomish River Near Monroe affecting Snohomish County. .The Snohomish river is cresting at Monroe early this morning. The flood crest will move downstream reaching Snohomish late this morning. The entire river will be receding this afternoon into tonight. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snohomish River at Snohomish. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, the Snohomish River will flood several roads...including the Snohomish-Monroe highway...and low areas of the lower Snohomish valley that are not protected by levees. A stage of 27 feet on the Snohomish River corresponds roughly to a Phase 2 in the Snohomish County flood program. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM PST Wednesday the stage was 27.7 feet. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will crest around 27.9 feet later this morning. The river will slowly recede this afternoon. The river will continue receding tonight falling below flood stage Thursday morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 1230 PM PST.
